image.altText: A woman sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: A vaccine for respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) has been approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) and will be available through private prescriptions for those 60 and above "very soon".

title.children: TGA approves RSV vaccine for use through private prescription for Australians over 60

image.altText: A woman smiles with a medal.

props.synopsis: Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins will be laid to rest at a private ceremony in Perth as today's Tour Down Under starts with a minute silence.

title.children: 'World class' Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins to be laid to rest at private ceremony in hometown

image.altText: A police four-wheel drive parked on the side of a long, unsealed outback road beneath a cloudless sky.

props.synopsis: The 25-year-old was reported missing on Sunday afternoon in the Durham area, near the South Australia border.

title.children: SA man's body found following two-day search in outback Queensland

image.altText: A man with tanned skin, wearing a baseball cap, and striped polo shirt stands with arms crossed over work bench in workshop.

props.synopsis: Sporting legends are made on the pitch, but the people behind the hallowed turf have as much enthusiasm as those playing.

title.children: What’s in a turf? The 'dark art' of curating one of Australia’s top cricket pitches

image.altText: Storm  clouds above a yellow church

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia are under a severe storm risk on Wednesday with likely severe storms in southern NSW and north-east Victoria.

title.children: Life-threatening flash flooding possible from mid-summer soaking with more storms forecast

image.altText: Pat Cummins prepares to bowl

props.synopsis: Australia takes on a much changed West Indies team in the second Test series of the summer at Adelaide Oval. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Cummins, Hazlewood strike after Australia wins the toss and bowls first in Adelaide

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: EDGED AND GONE! Hazlewood gets McKenzie!

image.altText: A police officer on a boat in Karumba.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with torture and slavery offences, following a police investigation in a remote part of Far North Queensland.

title.children: Deckhands swam through crocodile infested waters to escape being tortured, Queensland police allege

image.altText: A close-up photo of an old man, looking out into the distance, with clouds behind him

props.synopsis: An Irish Catholic priest played an important — but largely secret — role in the conflict over Northern Ireland.

title.children: This priest lived a secret life that helped the IRA 'reap carnage'

image.altText: Container ship at the Melbourne wharves

props.synopsis: The current row between a Dubai-owned stevedore, DP World, and the Maritime Union of Australia could reignite inflation and cause the Reserve Bank to continue lifting interest rates, experts say. There are calls for federal minister Tony Burke to intervene.

title.children: Australia could be stumbling into biggest waterfront dispute since the 1990s. Here's what it might mean for you

image.altText: A man in a dark hoodie walks away from a building beneath a pale sky.

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button has been formally charged with manslaughter after he was accused of dangerous driving leading to a crash that killed 10 wedding guests in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus driver formally charged with 10 counts of manslaughter over wedding crash

image.altText: Ales de Minaur runs to hit a two-handed backhand at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Australia's number one takes to Rod Laver Arena for his match against Matteo Arnaldi under the roof as rain falls at Melbourne Park, preventing play on outside courts. Follow live.

title.children: Alex de Minaur wins first set in Australian Open second round under the roof on Rod Laver Arena

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Alex de Minaur wins the first set on Rod Laver Arena
Another Russian makes it through to the third round, taking out former champ Caroline Wozniacki
Live score: Alex de Minaur starts his second-round clash

image.altText: A historic coloured postcard showing a small town and island linked by a bridge

props.synopsis: Dinner gongs, corned beef and pyjama parties — this is how people used to holiday to escape Adelaide's oppressive summer heat.

title.children: Lost era of guesthouses with their communal hospitality remembered in seaside town

image.altText: Josef Fritzl stands amid security guards

props.synopsis: A lawyers for the 88-year-old, currently serving a life sentence, say he can no longer walk unassisted and no longer poses any danger.

title.children: For 24 years, Josef Fritzl kept his daughter imprisoned in a secret cellar. Now his lawyer says he should be released

image.altText: Houthi fighters and tribesmen stand on and around a ute holding up guns.

props.synopsis: The US hit Houthi anti-ship ballistic missiles in its latest strikes against the group's targets in Yemen, after the rebels continued attacks in global shipping lanes.

title.children: US hits more Houthi targets in Yemen as rebels strike Greek cargo ship in Red Sea

image.altText: A close up of a pile of SIM cards lying on a table, overlapping and showing their metal contacts

props.synopsis: Authorities say nine customers had their SIM cards illegally swapped without them knowing, and five of them together lost more than $160,000.

title.children: Telco fined $260k after SIM-swapping scam leads customers to lose thousands

image.altText: A surveillance camera is silhouetted behind a Chinese national flag in Beijing.

props.synopsis: Australian shares slipped at the open. Chinese Premier Li Qiang says the country's economy is expected to have grown by about 5.2 per cent in 2023. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian shares open lower, China's economy expected to grow

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia set for a 'slow start' to meeting new housing targets: HIA
Iron ore miners rebound, but other resources stocks lead ASX lower
China economy grew around 5.2pc in 2023: Premier Li Qiang

image.altText: He stands in front of a grain silo

props.synopsis: Hopetoun locals brace for the impact of another wave of job losses, after First Quantum Minerals moves to suspend activities at its Ravensthorpe nickel operation on the state's south coast.

title.children: Job cuts at Ravensthorpe nickel mine in WA bring sense of deja vu to nearby residents

image.altText: Mirra Andreeva pumps her right fist after winning a point at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Teenager Mirra Andreeva puts the Australian Open on notice with a convincing defeat of world number six Ons Jabeur, who could only win two games against her younger opponent.

title.children: Russian 16yo thrashes Wimbledon finalist in massive Australian Open shock

image.altText: Aerial shot of new cars lined up at port

props.synopsis: A string of recent developments, from battery manufacturing to new engine efficiency rules, will affect the price you pay for a new car.

title.children: Battery prices are tipped to fall 40 per cent. Here's what that means for cheaper EVs

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: Some British Postal Service workers were jailed, others ostracised and some took their lives over theft convictions prompted by faulty software.

title.children: 900 British postal workers were wrongly convicted due to an IT error. Now, those responsible are apologising

image.altText: Primary school kids carrying backpacks on a rainy winter day.

props.synopsis: Parents are being squeezed by the cost of sending kids to school, whether their children are attending public or private, according to two new studies.

title.children: 'Free' public school education projected to cost parents more than $92,000 from prep to year 12

image.altText: A man and woman, both in suits, stand and speak to each other in front of a building and Australian and Israeli flags.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the funding will help provide emergency care and shelter in Gaza, while supporting refugee programs in Lebanon and Jordan.

title.children: Australia cautions Israel over humanitarian concerns, announces $21.5m in support for Gaza

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles on stage next to a sign saying TRUMP WINS IOWA

props.synopsis: The former president's resounding victory, called while many Republicans in Iowa were still waiting to vote for their presidential pick, was widely expected. But it still sets up an extraordinary primary season, writes Jade Macmillan.

title.children: Trump's record-breaking Iowa win was expected, but it's still extraordinary

image.altText: A court sketch showing a man in a suit and a woman sketched behind him.

props.synopsis: Writer E Jean Carroll is seeking at least $US10 million in damages in a civil case that will put sexual assault allegations against Donald Trump back in the headlines.

title.children: Donald Trump back in court for second defamation trial after Iowa victory

image.altText: Close up of Kim Jong Un speaking at a podium

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un says his country will no longer pursue reconciliation with South Korea, calling for rewriting the North’s constitution to eliminate the idea of shared statehood between the war-divided countries, according to state media.

title.children: North Korea will no longer pursue reconciliation with South because of hostility, Kim Jong Un says

image.altText: Bobi the dog sitting on the grass.

props.synopsis: Bobi's Guinness World Records title as oldest dog ever is under review after veterinarians raise doubts.

title.children: Guinness World Records reviews evidence related to 'world's oldest dog' title

image.altText: Black and dull pink photo of Osvaldo Perez, who died in Sydney's Inner West in 1981, and the tattoos on his thigh

props.synopsis: A fingerprint analysis in 2021 found the man's name was allegedly Osvaldo Perez, but this could also be an alias.

title.children: Fingerprint analysis suggests this is Osvaldo Perez. But police have no record he officially existed

image.altText: A split image of two smiling young women.

props.synopsis: A cold case investigation has resulted in a 62-year-old man being charged over the unrelated alleged abduction of a teenage girl in the Lake Macquarie region of New South Wales in the 1980s.

title.children: Cold case investigation into suspected murder of three teenagers leads to abduction charges

image.altText: A woman making a phone call in a parking lot with an X marking the spot

props.synopsis: With half the town of Corowa having almost no mobile phone coverage, the local council is calling on government and telecommunications companies to find a solution.

title.children: Mobile phone coverage is so bad in one southern NSW town, the golf club has painted an X where patrons can make a call

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt fans herself with a handheld fan as she smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: One in four people going through menopause will experience symptoms so severe it affects their quality of life. So why is there still a stigma? And what treatment options are available to those struggling?

title.children: Misinformation, stigma and lack of GP awareness among ongoing barriers to menopause treatment

image.altText: A film still of Andrew Scott and Paul Mescal in a busy nightclub. Mescal has his arm around Scott who is leaning over a bar.

props.synopsis: All of Us Strangers, starring Andrew Scott (Fleabag) and Paul Mescal (Normal People), uses a supernatural story to illuminate the beauty of queer relationships.

title.children: Two Irish heart-throbs star in this exquisite slow-burn queer romance that's also part ghost story

image.altText: Rhesus monkey in cage

props.synopsis: Scientists report cloning a monkey using a technique that most famously gave us Dolly the sheep in 1996. So what's new about this study, and what does it mean for humans?

title.children: What's so special about Retro the cloned rhesus monkey? Five quick questions answered
